docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, Nov. 30 -- Indonesia won a major victory in the United Nations today over the Netherlands, and indirectly over all the colonial powers. The General Assembly's Political Committee voted that the two countries should continue to try to...
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, Nov. 30 -- Indonesia won a major victory in the United Nations today over the Netherlands, and indirectly over all the colonial powers. The General Assembly's Political Committee voted that the two countries should continue to try to solve their dispute over West New Guinea.
docs.abstract: UN Assembly com, 34-14, votes that Indonesia and Netherlands should continue to try to settle W New Guinea dispute, 8-power compromise resolution; 10 abstain including US; Dutch silent; Repub aide Diapari repts Govt bars joint rule; warns US abstention indirectly backs colonialism; says bill is drafted to set up prov adm

headline.main: NEW GUINEA VOTE WON BY INDONESIA; U.N. Committee Backs, 34-14 Plea That Dutch Continue Talks on Disputed Area

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 1 -- The general conference of the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization voted tonight to broaden the dismissal powers of its director general, Dr. Luther Evans.

headline.main: UNESCO DIRECTOR GETS NEW POWER; Early Dismissal of Seven U. S. Employes Expected as Result of Action

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 2 (AP) -- The United States, India and Czechoslovakia -- nations that rarely agree on peace problems -won unanimous approval today of a resolution they sponsored jointly on living together peacefully.

docs.snippet: CHICAGO, Dec. 4 -- Millions of cattle are grazing on plains and millions more are in the feed lots of the Midwest, where corn is king. Millions of hogs are being fattened and sheep and lambs are eating their way toward the dinner table.

docs.snippet: A new small tanker, designed as the exception to the rule that only mammoth oil carriers can make profit, arrived last week on her first voyage to New York.
docs.lead_paragraph: A new small tanker, designed as the exception to the rule that only mammoth oil carriers can make profit, arrived last week on her first voyage to New York.
docs.abstract: refutes idea that only supertankers make profit

headline.main: 2,000-TON TANKER IN ON FIRST TRIP; Norwegians Seek to Refute Rule That Only Mammoth Carriers Make Profit

docs.snippet: Pope Pius XII is a tall, lean, wiry man, and by nature vigorous and animated. Years of mountain climbing and horseback riding before he became Pope gave him a sturdy constitution. His habit has been to put in sixteen hours of work a day -- every day.

docs.snippet: GENEVA, Dec. 4 (Reuters) -- The twenty-four-nation conference of the Intergovernmental Committee for European Migration adopted today a 1955 migration program to move 143,320 Europeans overseas on a total budget of $46,500,000.

docs.snippet: British sterling continued under pressure again last week, selling down to $2.78 1/2, lowest since October, 1952. Week's close was $2.78 25/32, a net loss of 3/16 cent from the previous week.
